verbatim_example: I've been messing around with heroin and bupe since about April - my most recent relapse. IV dope user for ~8 years.
I didn't sleep for a 4 day span in the past 2 weeks. I get so easily over-whelmed, and that feeling is really magnified when I stop dosing.
I only sleep hour stints, last week I was up for 4 days straight. Everything bothers me, my place is trashed from not doing crap for months...
I thought the benzo withdrawals kicked in that first week but now that I look back I think it was primarily opiate withdrawals.
The withdrawal was really intense, I was stuck to my apartment for almost the entire 3 weeks.
I'd usually take 2 and snort a half of one for a fast, hard come up and a pretty long high.
I am in the thick of wd.
I am scared bc I know I will want to use.
I am happy to be here, sober .
Every year, Ive celebrated by getting as high as possible. Not this year. I celebrated by not using.
I have been taking kratom since Tuesday to help withdrawal.
But not like opiates high (except for the puking);
Still have the morning GI lingering around but the malaise is still the biggest pain in the ass.
I still blow up the bathroom in the morning but it doesn't persist all day.
The worst the GI has been since day 6-7.
GI is still a little weird but subsides after 2 morning trips.
Still some morning GI stuff. Clams come and go.
Lingering symptoms are still morning GI/Restless when I try to relax/anxiety sweats.
Symptoms at 3 weeks out... morning shits (a very zen one this morning at least), anhedonia waves, come and go restless limbs.
Sunday morning the fog rolled back in. Emotional, tons of GI issues, anxiety sweats, depressed, stir crazy, irritable, restless.
still having some morning shit shows...
I've now gone five days without
Got lots of benzos just in case.
To my surprise I woke up hours later on the balcony covered in puke.
I was so fucked up on dope and xanax and kpins that i blacked out the entire way.
I had a major car accident and relapsed. In back to 3days.

The day I ran out I called in sick, since it had been so long since I'd experienced WD I was in absolutel agony, I literally layed in the shower crying for like 12 hours, every inch of my body hurt, migraines, sweating like a dog even though my condo was 62 degrees, throwing up,
the worst part of WD to me is not being able to sleep, and the dreaded RLS. Benzos/barbs seem to be the only thing that can help me sleep while in WD (besides actual opiates, obviously).

I bought some Kratom, and have some muscle relaxers for the withdrawl I may experience. But, truth be told - my withdrawl isn't anywhere near what I've seen in others. Bone pain and exhaustion is about it.

"I'd rather have artificial happiness that genuine depression." This implies the user is experiencing symptoms of opiate withdrawal, such as depression and craving for opiates.

Edit: I want to add that alcohol does both of us a world of hurt. Towards the beginning of my recovery, I was drinking often just to mentally cope with the opiate withdrawals (bad idea, i know) and it pretty much made my withdrawals worse in every aspect, and from what I've heard from most people is that alcohol temporarily helps the w/d.
Several months later, after the main w/d's were over, I had a glass of Maker's Mark, and threw up immediately. This happened on two separate occasions also. Same alcohol, different days.
